element.name: End of EMS Cardiac Arrest Event
element.definition: The patient's outcome at the end of the EMS event.
element.v3Comment:
A resuscitation event is deemed to have ended when death is declared or spontaneous circulation is restored and sustained for 20 minutes or longer.
This element is a component of the Utstein Cardiac Arrest Criteria as identified in the American Heart Association journal "Resuscitation" from 2004 entitled "Cardiac Arrest and Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation Outcome Reports". http://circ.ahajournals.org/cgi/content/full/110/21/3385
element.v3Changes: Added to better identify the outcome of EMS cardiac arrest patients.
